  • Admission Process

    Most institutes offering the course follow a merit- based admission process. The process involves an assessment of the candidate on the basis of score at the 10+2 level, and in a relevant national, State, or institute- level entrance test.pe.

  • Eligibility

    The minimum eligibility required to be met for admission to the course is a 10+2 qualification from a recognized educational Board with Physics and Mathematics as two of the main subjects with a minimum aggregate score of 50%. A few institutes in India also conduct a Common Entrance Examination for admission to the course wherein admission is based on the candidateâ€™s performance in both 10+2 examination and the entrance test.

    Average Course Fee --INR 5K to 5 Lacs
    Duration-- 3 years, full- time/ Distance Learning

  • Scope

    Starting Salary ---INR 2 to 25 Lacs
    Top Recruiting Companies Planetariums, Universities, Observatories, Laboratories, Defense and Space Research Organizations, Electrical Component Manufacturers, Electronic Equipment Manufacturers.

  • Course info

    B.Sc. in Astrophysics is an undergraduate involving the study of the physical and chemical properties of celestial bodies and the natural phenomena that occur in the universe.
